CreateOffspring
public List<NeatGenome<T>> CreateOffspring(
Species<T>[] speciesArr,
IRandomSource rng,
out int offspringAsexualCount,
out int offspringSexualCount,
out int offspringInterspeciesCount
)

Creates new offspring from existing parent genomes.

Each species contains a genome list, which should have been trimmed back to the elite genomes only, in order to make space for the new offspring. New offspring are created by application of sexual and asexual reproduction on the existing genomes.  The number of offspring genomes to create is determined by SpeciesStats.OffspringAsexualCount and SpeciesStats.OffspringSexualCount.

Parameters
speciesArr
Species<T>[]

An array of species, containing existing elite genomes.

rng
IRandomSource

Random source.

offspringAsexualCount
out int

Returns the number of new offspring created using asexual reproduction.

offspringSexualCount
out int

Returns the number of new offspring created using sexual reproduction.

offspringInterspeciesCount
out int

Returns the number of new offspring created using sexual reproduction between genomes from different species.

Returns

A new list containing the created offspring genomes.
